intro: Erigeron hirtus, commonly known as rough fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. It has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Erigeron hirtus blooms in the summer, producing yellow-centered flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
